title: Ticket #466: Multifacet users are filling /scratch
description:
A number of multifacet users are writing debug logs to /scratch. These are probably written by their jobs running under Condor. These files are frequently multi-gigabyte. This fills /scratch, and Condor essentially stops working.

Representative filenames include: 

ruby-MESI_CMP_filter_directory.Mar13.2009-17.52.53.debug
ruby-MOESI_CMP_token.Mar30.2009-18.47.13.debug
ruby-MOESI_CMP_token_wL1_woSL.May01.2009-14.53.28.debug
ruby-MOESI_CMP_token_wL1_woSL_woMM.Apr28.2009-20.01.32.debug
ruby-MOESI_Power6_I.Apr28.2009-19.23.51.debug

You can generally find them with "ruby-M*.debug". A tool for reporting on them can be found at /p/condor/workspaces/adesmet/multifacet-leak/find-leaks.

I've been contacting individual users, and it sounds like this is a debug setting that is one, but can be easily turned off. However, I keep seeing it. A general notice probably needs to go out to Multifacet: Please avoid writing to /scratch, if at all possible keep all of your output inside of your current working directory. (Check for Condor-specific temp?)
creator: adesmet
